title: How to Make Your iPhone Screen Black and White or Grayscale

steps.title: Open your iPhone's Settings .
steps.content: Open your iPhone's Settings . You'll see this gray gear icon on your Home screen or in your App Library. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Accessibility.
steps.content: Tap Accessibility . It's in the third group of settings. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Display & Text Size.
steps.content: Tap Display & Text Size . It's near the top of the first group of settings. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Color Filters.
steps.content: Tap Color Filters . This will open your color filter options, which includes grayscale. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Slide the Color Filters switch to .
steps.content: Slide the Color Filters switch to . This will enable color filters on your iPhone and allow you to select one of the available filters. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Tap Grayscale.
steps.content: Tap Grayscale . This is the first option in the list of color filters. This will instantly change your display to black-and-white (grayscale). You can toggle off the Color Filters switch anytime to bring color back to your screen.
